info.description: API to create, update and manage the customers' (data subjects') data protection consent and rights for the processing of their personal data. It defines a set of enhanced rights for individuals over the collection, usage of their personal data and the right to restrict processing.
info.title: Customer Data protection rights management

put.description: Approves the consent request of the customer for processing of personal data which contains type of a consent, subtype of a type entered, consent withdraw etc.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.description: Retrieves the details of the consent recorded in system for processing of personal data For example - consentType, consentSubType, consentGiven etc. details of the customer consent can be fetched.. For example - the details include consent type, consent sub type, withdrawal of consent, to check whether the consent is given for a type, for a sub type etc.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: consentId
parameters.description: Identifier of the corresponding consent object as retrieved by an account Information consent Request.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

put.description: Updates the consent details of the customer for processing of personal data. For example - consentType, consentSubType, consentWithdrawn etc. details of the customer consent will be updated.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

put.summary: Revokes the consent provided by the customer
put.description: Allows the revocation of the consent provided by the customer so as to stop any further processing of personal data. The consent cannot be processed further once it is revoked.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

post.description: Initiates the consent request of the customer for processing of personal data. The details used to initiate a consent are consent type, sub type of a consent type, to check whether the consent is provided, consent withdrawal etc.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Returns the status of a customer Consent. i.e., if the consent is valid or not
get.description: API to return the validity of a customer consent by returning the status of customer consent.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: arrangement
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the arrangement contract

parameters.name: consentType
parameters.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

parameters.name: consentSubType
parameters.description: Indicates the consent sub type linked to corresponding consent type.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

post.description: Initiates the data rights management request of the customer for exercising the various rights under the data protection rules, which defines significant new privacy requirements for companies and provides rights for individuals over the collection and usage of their personal data and the right to restrict processing. It creates a request with following details of a customer. For example - request type, request status, original expiry date of request etc.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

put.description: Approves the data rights management request of the customer for exercising the various rights under the data protection rules, which has significant enhanced rights for individuals over the collection and usage of their personal data and the right to restrict processing.It approves a request with following details of a customer. For example - request type, request status, original expiry date of request etc.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

put.description: Updates the data rights management details of the customer for processing of personal data. It has significantly enhanced rights for individuals over the collection and usage of their personal data and the right to restrict processing. It updates a request with following details of a customer. For example - request type, request status, original expiry date of request etc.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.description: Retrieves the data rights details of the customer for processing of personal data. It has significantly enhanced rights for individuals over the collection and usage of their personal data and the right to restrict processing. It returns significant details of request of a customer. For example - request type, request status, original expiry date of request etc.

parameters.name: partyId
parameters.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Contains status of the data rights request.Allowed values are INITIATED, INPROGESS, EXTENDED, COMPLETED, REJECTED.

parameters.name: currExpiryDate
parameters.description: Contains the current expiry date of the data rights request.

parameters.name: requestType
parameters.description: Contains customer data rights request type. Example: ERASURE/DATAPORTABILITY.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

aaaId.description: The Identifier of the aa record created

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

customers.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

customer.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

arrangement.description: Unique identifier for the arrangement contract

product.description: Indicates an id or name of a product

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

activity.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

consentTypes.description: Indicates the consent sub type linked to corresponding consent type.

consentType.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

isConsentGiven.description: Indicates whether the consent is given for a specific type. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

consentGivenDate.description: Indicates the date on which the consent was given by a customer for a specific consent type.

isConsentWithdrawn.description: Indicates if the consent given for the particular consent type is withdrawn.

consentWithdrawDate.description: Indicates the date on which the consent was withdrawn.

consentTypeExpiryDate.description: Indicates the expiry date of a consent type.

consentBlock.description: Indicates whether consent is blocked or not. No personal data of the Client will be shared by the Bank for any purpose when the consent is blocked.

blockNotes.description: Indicates the reason for which the consent is blocked.

consentWithdrawNotes.description: Indicates the reason for which the consent is withdrawn.

channelId.description: Id of the (digital) channel.It is a conditional field for customer data protection consent.

consentSubType.description: Indicates the consent sub type linked to corresponding consent type.

isSubTypeConsentGiven.description: Indicates whether consent is given for specific consent subtype. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

isSubTypeConsentWithdrawn.description: Indicates whether the consent for a specific sub type of a consent type is withdrawn or not.

consentStWithdrawDate.description: Indicates the date on which a specific sub type of a consent type is withdrawn.

consentStGivenDate.description: Indicates the date on which the consent was given by a customer for a specific consent sub type.

consentStExpiryDate.description: Indicates the expiry date of a consent subtype.

channel.description: The ID of the Channel. It is a conditional field for customer data protection consent.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

code.description: The code related to override message.

options.description: The usable options for the override.

The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

isBlocked.description: Balance Netting is blocked or Not

consentStatus.description: Status of the consent. This can be of received, valid, expired, terminatedByTpp or revokedByPsu.

erasurePurpose.description: Specifies the customer data protection purpose for erasure. For example - CONSENT, LEGAL, TAX, MARKETING, LEGITIMATE, CONTRACT.

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyType.description: Indicates the type of customer which is part of the relationship. It may be Customer, Person or Entity.

requestType.description: Contains customer data rights request type. Example: ERASURE/DATAPORTABILITY.

newExpiryDate.description: Contains the new expiry date of data rights request.

status.description: Contains status of the data rights request.Allowed values are INITIATED, INPROGESS, EXTENDED, COMPLETED, REJECTED.

requestNewAction.description: Contains the action which the account officer has initiated.Values allowed are NEW, EXTEND, COMPLETE, REJECT.

newAmendmentNotes.description: Contains the new amendment notes of the data rights request.

approveRequest.description: Indicates whether the data rights request is to be approved. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

channelId.description: Id of the (digital) channel.It is a conditional field for customer data protection consent.

applicationName.description: Specifies the name of the application to be considered for erasure of details for customer data protection purposes

contractId.description: Identifies the unique identifier of the transaction or contract.

companyId.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

erasurePurpose.description: Specifies the customer data protection purpose for erasure. For example - CONSENT, LEGAL, TAX, MARKETING, LEGITIMATE, CONTRACT.

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyType.description: Indicates the type of customer which is part of the relationship. It may be Customer, Person or Entity.

requestType.description: Contains customer data rights request type. Example: ERASURE/DATAPORTABILITY.

newExpiryDate.description: Contains the new expiry date of data rights request.

status.description: Contains status of the data rights request.Allowed values are INITIATED, INPROGESS, EXTENDED, COMPLETED, REJECTED.

requestNewAction.description: Contains the action which the account officer has initiated.Values allowed are NEW, EXTEND, COMPLETE, REJECT.

newAmendmentNotes.description: Contains the new amendment notes of the data rights request.

approveRequest.description: Indicates whether the data rights request is to be approved. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

channelId.description: Id of the (digital) channel.It is a conditional field for customer data protection consent.

applicationName.description: Specifies the name of the application to be considered for erasure of details for customer data protection purposes

contractId.description: Identifies the unique identifier of the transaction or contract.

companyId.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001

requestType.description: Contains customer data rights request type. Example: ERASURE/DATAPORTABILITY.

originalExpiryDate.description: Contains date calculated based on the Request Type entered along with the expiry days as prescribed under GDPR towards compliance.

creationDate.description: Contains the creation date of data rights request.

newExpiryDate.description: Contains the new expiry date of data rights request.

status.description: Contains status of the data rights request.Allowed values are INITIATED, INPROGESS, EXTENDED, COMPLETED, REJECTED.

requestNewAction.description: Contains the action which the account officer has initiated.Values allowed are NEW, EXTEND, COMPLETE, REJECT.

newAmendmentNotes.description: Contains the new amendment notes of the data rights request.

newOfficer.description: Specifies officer in charge of action specified. Contains valid id from DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER.

internalAction.description: Indicates if the request is to be resubmitted or cancelled. Allowed values are RESUBMIT, CANCELLED

isReqComplete.description: Specifies whether the data rights request is complete or not.

approveRequest.description: Indicates whether the data rights request is to be approved. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

systemStatus.description: Contains status of request in the system. Examples are INITIATED, ERROR, COMPLETED.

currExpiryDate.description: Contains the current expiry date of the data rights request.
